column1: Justice Amerasinghe has pointed out further in Professional Ethics and Responsibilities
of Lawyers [supra] that, “In general, a lawyer comes into a matter only of he is ‘instructed’
by a client” [page 304] and “An attorney should not act in a professional capacity for a
party in any matter, whether contentious or otherwise, except at the request of a party or
at the request of a registered attorney.” [page 305] Thus, it is a fundamental requirement
